page.title: 17SAND DIGGING
page.content:
For many years the sand has been dug at a number of pits in St Ouen's Bay.
One pit is just to the south of the Conservation area called La Mielle de Morville and is used to dig sand for the building industry.
Because the sand was needed the States of Jersey zoned this area and another one to the south for sand extraction.
When the extraction is finished the pits will be restored as part of the plan to conserve the area.
In the past the empty pits were used as refuse tips and there were smells and pollution which were difficult to get rid of.
In future much more care will be taken
